structure: Ensure your resume has a clear structure with sections like Contact Information, Education, Skills, Projects, and Work Experience.
Use bullet points for easy readability.
formatting: Choose a clean and professional font.
Keep the resume length to one page if possible.
tailoring: Tailor your resume for each job application. Customize it to match the job requirements.
Use keywords from the job description to optimize your resume for Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS).
proofreading: Proofread your resume carefully to avoid typos and grammatical errors.
Ask a friend or mentor to review your resume for feedback.

contactInformation: The contact information section includes your name, phone number, and professional email address.
Make sure your contact information is up-to-date and professional.
education: The education section should list your academic achievements, including degrees, institutions, and graduation dates.
Highlight any relevant honors or awards you received during your education.
skills: The skills section is crucial. Include both technical and soft skills relevant to the job you're applying for.
Consider categorizing your skills to make it easier for recruiters to quickly identify your strengths.
experience: The experience section details your work history. Include your job titles, company names, and dates of employment.
Focus on quantifiable achievements and responsibilities in each role.
projects: The projects section is a great way to showcase your hands-on experience. Describe the projects you've worked on and the technologies used.
Include any open-source contributions or personal projects that demonstrate your skills.
achievements: The achievements section highlights your accomplishments. Include any awards, certifications, or recognition you've received.
Quantify your achievements to add impact to your resume.
